title: UK Persecutes Bengali Australian Star Sam Kerr , Ignores united kingdom - Australian WW2 Bengal Holocaust
body_text:

The core ethos of Humanity is Kindness and Truth but in gross violation of both of these key moral imperatives the White Anglosphere Establishments and Establishment-serving Mainstream media are resolutely committed to lying by commission and lying by omission about Western-imposed genocidal atrocities, and hence are deeply complicit in such crimes. Silence is complicity.
Summarized with documentation below are details of (a) the Sam Kerr non-story of alleged momentary verbal intemperance (allegedly saying “Stupid white bastard”) that is dominating the Anglo media, and (b) the forgotten WW2 Bengali Holocaust and other Western atrocities over the last 80 years (i.e. within living memory) that are variously minimized and excused by genocidally racist and egregiously lying White Anglosphere journalist, politician and academic presstitutes.
(1). Sam Kerr – brilliant Bengali Australian footballer.
According to Britannica: “Sam Kerr (born September 10, 1993, Fremantle, Western Australia) Australian football (soccer) player who was named captain of the Matildas, the women’s national team, in 2019. The star striker later became the all-time leading scorer for the team. Kerr was also a standout in professional clubs in the United States, England, and Australia… Kerr was born the youngest of four siblings in a family with a long tradition of athletics. Her father, Roger Kerr, was born in Kolkata to a featherweight boxer for Bengal and a mother who played basketball. After moving to Perth as a child, he played Australian rules football, a contact sport with similarities to rugby. He became a professional player with the West Australian Football League and the South Australian National Football League and later a coach in the WAFL. His eldest son, Daniel Kerr, Sam Kerr’s brother, also became a professional athlete, playing Australian rules football. Meanwhile, Sam Kerr’s mother, Roxanne Kerr, was the daughter and niece of players in the WAFL” [1]. Sam Kerr has become an Australian national icon (and an especial inspiration for girls) for her brilliant performances for the Australian Matilda’s and for Chelsea in the UK. Sadly she is presently recovering from a serious injury and will probably miss playing for Australia at the Paris Olympics.

(2). Sam Kerr’s alleged offence – allegedly calling a UK policeman a “stupid white bastard”.
I obviously don’t know what happened but Michael Bradley (in the commendable Alternative Australian medium Crikey): “Working backwards, it turned out, Sam had called a British copper a “stupid white bastard” (although some UK media has reported it as “stupid white PC”) after she’d had a drunken altercation with a taxi driver following her chundering [vomiting] in his cab…Still, there are serious questions here. Kerr is facing a criminal trial on charges that carry a maximum penalty of two years in jail. From what I can work out, the charge against her comes under section 4A of the UK Public Order Act, which makes it an offence when a person, with intent, uses threatening, abusive or insulting words or behaviour, causing another person harassment, alarm or distress” [2].

This brilliant sportswoman and Australian national hero is being threatened with 2 years in a British prison that would mean the end of her brilliant and inspiring football career. One is reminded of the British foundation of Australia as a penal colony in 1788 – children could be sentenced to death by “British justice” for stealing a handkerchief or food with this being “mercifully” judicially commuted to transportation as a convict to Australia [3]. However the imperialist English Establishment have always had an endless capacity to soften the awful or even eradicate it from general perception.

On a deadly serious level, my book “Jane Austen and the Black Hole of British History. Colonial rapacity, holocaust denial and the crisis in biological sustainability” [5] is concerned with exposing this English and more generally Anglosphere culture of US and US Alliance holocaust commission and holocaust denial that grossly violates the key ethos of Humanity, namely Kindness and Truth.
Due to British “justice” Australian hero, world hero, prize-winning journalist and truth-teller Julian Assange was imprisoned in the Ecuadorean Embassy for 7 years to escape “British justice” and has been highly abusively imprisoned for a further 5 years in Belmarsh Prison in London by “British justice”. In the Napoleonic Wars in Spain the British defeated the French by withdrawing across Spain and Portugal to British Navy-supplied Lisbon, burning the crops as they went – the French were defeated by lack of food. In Bengal the British under Churchill sustainably permitted a catastrophic man-made famine that ensured that if the Japanese invaded from Burma they would face a starving north east India [5, 16].
Indian-hating, genocidal racist and imperialist Winston Churchill (our hero for opposing Nazi Germany), was a keen student of history, and knew exactly what he was doing. Before the war India depended upon importing about 3 million tons of rice and other grain to cover production deficits, but by 1942 it was actually exporting rice and other grain. Indeed in 1935 Churchill had made the following statement to the British House of Commons: “In the standard of life they have nothing to spare. The slightest fall from the present standard of life in India means slow starvation, and the actual squeezing out of life, not only of millions but of scores of millions of people, who have come into the world at your invitation and under the shield and protection of British power”. The British knew that decreased food availability per se or through price increases would doom millions to starvation. In a secret letter to Roosevelt on 29 April 1944, Churchill , in his only statement on the Bengal Famine that I have found): “We have the wheat in Australia but we lack the ships. I have resisted for some time the Viceroy’s request that I should ask you for your help, but I believe that, with this recent misfortune with the wheat harvest and in the light of Mountbatten’s representations, I am no longer justified in not asking for your help” [5]. Australia produced 24 million tons of grain during WW2 but exported only 9 million (to the UK, North Africa and the Middle East) with as little as 0.4 million tons reaching its starving ally India [5, 16-23]. The WW2 Bengali Holocaust was actually the first WW2 atrocity to have been described as a holocaust (by N.G. Jog in his 1944 book “Churchill’s Blind-Spot: India” [24]). Eminent Oxford historian and expert on Winston Churchill, WW1, WW2, Jewish history and Zionism, the late Professor Sir Martin Gilbert, was one of very few historians to have actually mentioned the WW2 Bengal Famine, but he under-estimated the death toll of 7 million by a factor of about 10, excused deadly British inaction as due to the strategic priorities of a world war, and avoided any mention of the atrocity in his biographies of Churchill [25]. Indeed Churchill, the perpetrator, made no mention of the atrocity in his 6-volume history “The Second World War” for which he was awarded the Nobel Prize for literature [5].
